meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Colin Bodels Jessica Lee Paul Nelson Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6472.

td.p: Colin Bodels, a creative director and branding consultant from Drexel Hill, Pennsylvania
Jessica Lee, an immigration attorney from Evanston, Illinois
Paul Nelson, a Senate staff aide originally from Iowa City, Iowa (whose 2-day cash winnings total $29,200)

tr.td: A YEAR IN THE LIFE
"OO" WHAT'S THAT?
LONG SONGS
WORLD CAPITAL ATTRACTIONS
RUNNING
WITH SCISSORS

toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'Robert E. Lee

Paul
')

toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', '1861:

div.h3: Scores at the first commercial break (after clue 15):

tr.td: Paul
Jessica
Colin

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: Paul
Jessica
Colin
LITERARY AWARDS
GODLY EXPRESSIONS
FOOD STUFF
WE'VE GOT TO STOP MEETING LIKE THIS
MOVIES: WHO PLAYED 'EM?
"G", I LOVE SCIENCE
(Alex: Each correct response will begin with that letter.)

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: [To Jessica] Yes, "If you see something, say something.")
...
(Paul: [As his response is being revealed] I\'m sorry, Janet!)
JessicaWhat is the Department of Homeland Security?
$1,900
ColinWhat is the Dept. of Health?
$8,200

$1,900
Homeland Security')

"Si ve algo, diga algo" was part of a 2011 Spanish-language TV campaign by this Cabinet department
Paul
Jessica
Colin

2nd place: $2,000
3rd place: $1,000
Paul
Jessica
Colin

27 R
(including 2 DDs),
3 W

8 R,
2 W

(including 1 DD),
2 W

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law. This website is not affiliated with, sponsored by, or operated by Jeopardy Productions, Inc. Join the discussion at JBoard.tv.
